thread.title: Update: Alec Baldwin not in 'Pottersville' project, Film House producer now says
thread.title_full: Update: Alec Baldwin not in 'Pottersville' project, Film House producer now says

author: Teri Weaver | tweaver@syracuse.com
title: Update: Alec Baldwin not in 'Pottersville' project, Film House producer now says
text:
SYRACUSE, N.Y. -- A Central New York film producer made a mistake earlier today when he said that Alec Baldwin, Michael Shannon and Adam Scott are part of a new movie called "Pottersville," lawyers for the film project said. 
The earlier news came from Ryan Johnson, the head of The Film House, located in DeWitt. 
"I don't know why Ryan is speaking to something he doesn't know about," said Christian Simonds, a lawyer with Gray, Krauss, Stratford, Sandler, Des Rochers in Beverly Hills, Calif. 
Johnson said later today he made a mistake. "We're in negotiations with several people," he said. "Casts are to be announced officially in the next couple of weeks." 
Johnson said earlier this afternoon his film company has two more projects scheduled to start filming in the Syracuse area early next year. He said those projects were "Pottersville" and "The Divorce Party." 
"Pottersville" is also being produced by Ron Perlman's Wing and a Prayer production company. 
Simonds said Baldwin passed on "Pottersville" because of a scheduling conflict. 
Johnson's Film House is the production company behind "American Dresser," which finished filming in the Syracuse area last month.
